5.9.21  5:35 am   I think people keep asking "when's the album coming" because they expect you to make a fully commercial album, released by big record label, imprinted on cd/vinyl. Maybe that would be a good idea 10-15 years ago, but considering the changing circumstances in the industry, self-publishing becomes more profitable, thus more preferable option. What do you think?

5.8.21  8:45 pm   hey bill! i have this kinda old song that ive been trying to work on, and i cant for the life of me figure out a bridge/new part for it, and i feel it needs something.
its a slow thing kinda r&b-ish, and it chord plays for one bar:
the verses are a Cmaj7 - Am7 - Dm7 - F/G loop, and the chorus is Fm7 - Em7 - Am7 - Dm7 x2 coming right after the Dm7 in the last bar of the verse, and after the chorus theres a transitional F/G to return to the verses.
so far i have a verse/chorus/verse/chorus structure and i want to write a bridge after that 2nd chorus, but then i would like to somehow arrive to a Fm7 to have a 3rd and final chorus/ending kinda thing. any recommendations? ideas?
5.8.21  7:20 pm   what's the story behind the bread at the end of 7.1.14 tuesday video?

5.8.21  6:36 pm   Hey bill. So I've read a lot of other questions about writing melodies/lyrics at the same time. I have applied it and got some nice verse melodies with lyrics I like too.  But now I'm in a predicament with the second verse. Now I'm kind of back to trying to puzzle piece lyrics into the preexisting verse melody. I've tried to come up with a new melody/lyrics but then it seems too unrelated to the beginning. So what's the technique for getting around this/ what do you do to help with writing second verses are things like them? Thank so much!!

5.7.21  8:04 pm   Hearing your thoughts on 12TET and your experiments with just intonation was really cool! Have you done any similar tinkering with tuning systems like 19TET, 24TET, etc?

     I'm really interested to try and experiment with them myself but I'm having difficulty figuring out how to do that in a way that isn't weird.

You can use a normal midi-controller to try to make 24TET music, but doing that for any extended period of time seems like it would be confusing to work with if you're somebody who already has normal 12TET piano muscle memory. Without hardware made for microtones or a standardized system of notation it seems like a difficult thing to incorporate into the existing system. What are your thoughts on all of this?
